intro: Styphonia atra, commonly known as black styphonia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom during the rainy season. Styphonia atra is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and horticultural research.
